questions.question: The minister was forced to take his controversial remarks …………………….
questions.description: To take something back is to withdraw a statement.

questions.question: Be careful. He might try to take you ………………………
questions.description: To take somebody in is to cheat them.

questions.question: This blouse is loose for me. I must take it ……………………….
questions.description: To take something in is to make a garment tighter.

questions.question: She was not capable of taking her children ……………………… hand
questions.description: To take somebody in hand is to control them.

questions.question: The plane is about to take …………………….. Please wear your seat belts.
questions.description: When a plane takes off, it becomes airborne.

questions.question: You must take your shoes ……………………… before entering the temple.
questions.description: To take a piece of clothing off is to remove it.

questions.question: Nobody was willing to take ………………………… the responsibility.
questions.description: To take on is to accept.

questions.question: I know you had a bad day at work, but you can’t take it ……………………….. on me.
questions.description: To take it out on somebody is to relieve your frustration by treating someone badly.

questions.question: Profits of the firm increased after she took ……………….. as the CEO.
questions.description: To take over is to assume control of something.

questions.question: The children took ……………………… their new teacher immediately.
questions.description: To take to somebody is to start to like them.

questions.question: He quit his corporate job to take …………………….. farming.
